{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "UI / UX Designer",
  "description": "FeclesHost is a registered Web Hosting and Domain Registration Company in Nigeria, empowering digital success for businesses and individuals through innovative, reliable, and affordable online infrastructure. Founded on June 21, 2024, FeclesHost has rapidly grown to become one of the most trusted names in Africa&rsquo;s hosting industry. We are committed to delivering excellence through cutting-edge technology, unmatched uptime, and world-class customer support. At FeclesHost, our mission is to make web hosting simple, secure, and scalable &mdash; helping entrepreneurs, developers, and enterprises bring their ideas to life on the internet. We are renowned for our responsive customer support, transparent pricing, and customer-first approach, ensuring every client receives real value and confidence in their digital journey.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: UI / UX Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Volunteer

Description


	At FeclesHost, we believe that great companies are built by great people who are passionate, creative, driven, and ready to grow.
	As we continue expanding our digital footprint and pushing new boundaries in hosting, cloud solutions, and user-focused innovation, we are opening our doors to talented individuals who want to be part of something meaningful.


Responsibilities


	Ensures platform usability and seamless user experience. (Makes Fecleshost interfaces professional and user-friendly.)


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and work experience.


Why You Should Join Us (Even as a Volunteer)


	FeclesHost is still growing, evolving, and building.
	Every step we take opens new opportunities, and every person who joins us becomes part of the foundation of something bigger.
	By joining our team now:
	
		You grow as the company grows every contribution you make becomes part of our long-term story.
		You gain hands-on experience in a high-impact environment where your ideas matter.
		You work closely with a supportive team that believes in collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
		You build a solid portfolio working on real projects that shape real customer experiences.
		You gain visibility and potential transition into paid roles as expansion continues.
	
	


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV or Portfolio to:&nbsp;career@fecleshost.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	This Is a voluntary position with opportunities to transition into a paid role.
	For more enquiry contact the recruiter on: +2348138901857 or&nbsp;info@fecleshost.com.ng
",
  "datePosted": "2025-11-19",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "FeclesHost"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

UI / UX Designer Job at FeclesHost




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

FeclesHost is a registered Web Hosting and Domain Registration Company in Nigeria, empowering digital success for businesses and individuals through innovative, reliable, and affordable online infrastructure. Founded on June 21, 2024, FeclesHost has rapidly grown to become one of the most trusted names in Africa’s hosting industry. We are committed to delivering excellence through cutting-edge technology, unmatched uptime, and world-class customer support. At FeclesHost, our mission is to make web hosting simple, secure, and scalable — helping entrepreneurs, developers, and enterprises bring their ideas to life on the internet. We are renowned for our responsive customer support, transparent pricing, and customer-first approach, ensuring every client receives real value and confidence in their digital journey.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: UI / UX Designer

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Volunteer

Description


	At FeclesHost, we believe that great companies are built by great people who are passionate, creative, driven, and ready to grow.
	As we continue expanding our digital footprint and pushing new boundaries in hosting, cloud solutions, and user-focused innovation, we are opening our doors to talented individuals who want to be part of something meaningful.


Responsibilities


	Ensures platform usability and seamless user experience. (Makes Fecleshost interfaces professional and user-friendly.)


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and work experience.


Why You Should Join Us (Even as a Volunteer)


	FeclesHost is still growing, evolving, and building.
	Every step we take opens new opportunities, and every person who joins us becomes part of the foundation of something bigger.
	By joining our team now:
	
		You grow as the company grows every contribution you make becomes part of our long-term story.
		You gain hands-on experience in a high-impact environment where your ideas matter.
		You work closely with a supportive team that believes in collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
		You build a solid portfolio working on real projects that shape real customer experiences.
		You gain visibility and potential transition into paid roles as expansion continues.
	
	


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV or Portfolio to: career@fecleshost.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	This Is a voluntary position with opportunities to transition into a paid role.
	For more enquiry contact the recruiter on: +2348138901857 or 

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Warehouse Associate",
  "description": "Zhuli Recruiters is a recruitment firm that is committed to serving start-ups.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Associate

Job Location:&nbsp;Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role:


	The Warehouse Associate will support daily warehouse operations, ensuring accurate inventory management, proper documentation, and adherence to safety and organizational standards.
	The role involves handling stock movement, maintaining order in the warehouse, and assisting in reporting and logistics processes.


Key Responsibilities


	Receive, document, and organize incoming and outgoing merchandise.
	Inspect and report missing, damaged, or lost items.
	Ensure proper packing, labeling, and storage of all goods.
	Maintain warehouse organization and cleanliness according to SOPs.
	Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) for stock management.
	Conduct periodic stock checks and prepare reports.
	Supervise waybill preparation for final deliveries.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / BSc in Supply Chain Management or related field.
	At least 1 year of experience in inventory or warehouse management.
	Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.
	Basic knowledge of ERP systems is an advantage.
	Strong communication and organizational skills.
",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-20",

  },

Warehouse Associate Job at Zhuli Recruiters




        
    

        
        Zhuli Recruiters is a recruitment firm that is committed to serving start-ups.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Associate

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role:


	The Warehouse Associate will support daily warehouse operations, ensuring accurate inventory management, proper documentation, and adherence to safety and organizational standards.
	The role involves handling stock movement, maintaining order in the warehouse, and assisting in reporting and logistics processes.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Receive, document, and organize incoming and outgoing merchandise.
	Inspect and report missing, damaged, or lost items.
	Ensure proper packing, labeling, and storage of all goods.
	Maintain warehouse organization and cleanliness according to SOPs.
	Implement FIFO (First In, First Out) for stock management.
	Conduct periodic stock checks and prepare reports.
	Supervise waybill preparation for final deliveries.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / BSc in Supply Chain Management or related field.
	At least 1 year of experience in inventory or warehouse management.
	Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.
	Basic knowledge of ERP systems is an advantage.
	Strong communication and organizational skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "ASHEC Consulting is a dynamic HR outsourcing and recruitment firm dedicated to servingNigeria&rsquo;s small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). With deep local insight and a client-firstmindset, we specialize in end-to-end hiring, HR structuring, payroll compliance, and workforcedevelopment. Our lean operational model allows us to deliver fast, affordable, and legallysound HR services, helping growing businesses scale without the overhead of a full HR department. Whether you need one hire or full HR outsourcing, ASHEC delivers results withclarity, speed, and simplicity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Ogbomoso, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented individual to manage the farm&rsquo;s financial records and ensure accurate tracking of all income and expenditure.
	The role involves bookkeeping, preparing financial reports, monitoring cash flow, and supporting management in making informed financial decisions.


Key Responsibilities


	Record and maintain accurate bookkeeping of all farm financial transactions (inflows and outflows).
	Monitor daily expenses, purchases, and sales to ensure accountability.
	Prepare weekly and monthly financial reports for management review.
	Reconcile bank statements, petty cash, and other financial accounts.
	Assist in preparing budgets, forecasts, and financial planning for farm operations.
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards, company policies, and relevant regulations.
	Support procurement and inventory management with financial record-keeping.
	Collaborate with the Farm Manager and Head of Farm Security to monitor costs related to production and farm assets.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in accounting, bookkeeping, or financial management (agricultural or SME setting is an advantage).
	Must be based in or willing to work in Ogbomoso
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Excel).
	Strong attention to detail, organizational, and analytical skills.
	Good communication skills with the ability to work independently and in a team.
	Integrity, accountability, and a proactive attitude toward financial management.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;

Accountant Job at ASHEC Consulting




        
    

        
        ASHEC Consulting is a dynamic HR outsourcing and recruitment firm dedicated to servingNigeria’s small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). With deep local insight and a client-firstmindset, we specialize in end-to-end hiring, HR structuring, payroll compliance, and workforcedevelopment. Our lean operational model allows us to deliver fast, affordable, and legallysound HR services, helping growing businesses scale without the overhead of a full HR department. Whether you need one hire or full HR outsourcing, ASHEC delivers results withclarity, speed, and simplicity.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Ogbomoso, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Summary


	We are seeking a detail-oriented individual to manage the farm’s financial records and ensure accurate tracking of all income and expenditure.
	The role involves bookkeeping, preparing financial reports, monitoring cash flow, and supporting management in making informed financial decisions.


Key Responsibilities


	Record and maintain accurate bookkeeping of all farm financial transactions (inflows and outflows).
	Monitor daily expenses, purchases, and sales to ensure accountability.
	Prepare weekly and monthly financial reports for management review.
	Reconcile bank statements, petty cash, and other financial accounts.
	Assist in preparing budgets, forecasts, and financial planning for farm operations.
	Ensure compliance with accounting standards, company policies, and relevant regulations.
	Support procurement and inventory management with financial record-keeping.
	Collaborate with the Farm Manager and Head of Farm Security to monitor costs related to production and farm assets.


Requirements


	OND / HND / B.Sc. in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 - 3 years of experience in accounting, bookkeeping, or financial management (agricultural or SME setting is an advantage).
	Must be based in or willing to work in Ogbomoso
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Excel).
	Strong attention to detail, organizational, and analytical skills.
	Good communication skills with the ability to work independently and in a team.
	Integrity, accountability, and a proactive attitude toward financial management.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 Monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified companies should send their CV and Cover Letter stating the preferred class to: ashecoutsourcing@gmail.com using “Accountant” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Back End Developer",
  "description": "FeclesHost is a registered Web Hosting and Domain Registration Company in Nigeria, empowering digital success for businesses and individuals through innovative, reliable, and affordable online infrastructure. Founded on June 21, 2024, FeclesHost has rapidly grown to become one of the most trusted names in Africa&rsquo;s hosting industry. We are committed to delivering excellence through cutting-edge technology, unmatched uptime, and world-class customer support. At FeclesHost, our mission is to make web hosting simple, secure, and scalable &mdash; helping entrepreneurs, developers, and enterprises bring their ideas to life on the internet. We are renowned for our responsive customer support, transparent pricing, and customer-first approach, ensuring every client receives real value and confidence in their digital journey.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Back End Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Volunteer

Description


	At FeclesHost, we believe that great companies are built by great people who are passionate, creative, driven, and ready to grow.
	As we continue expanding our digital footprint and pushing new boundaries in hosting, cloud solutions, and user-focused innovation, we are opening our doors to talented individuals who want to be part of something meaningful.


Responsibilities


	Handles server-side logic, database, and integrations. (Ensures everything runs smoothly behind the scenes.)


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and work experience.


Why You Should Join Us (Even as a Volunteer)


	FeclesHost is still growing, evolving, and building.
	Every step we take opens new opportunities, and every person who joins us becomes part of the foundation of something bigger.
	By joining our team now:
	
		You grow as the company grows every contribution you make becomes part of our long-term story.
		You gain hands-on experience in a high-impact environment where your ideas matter.
		You work closely with a supportive team that believes in collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
		You build a solid portfolio working on real projects that shape real customer experiences.
		You gain visibility and potential transition into paid roles as expansion continues.
	
	


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV or Portfolio to:&nbsp;career@fecleshost.com.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	This Is a voluntary position with opportunities to transition into a paid role.
	For more enquiry contact the recruiter on: +2348138901857 or&nbsp;info@fecleshost.com.ng

Back End Developer Job at FeclesHost




        
    

        
        
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    

FeclesHost is a registered Web Hosting and Domain Registration Company in Nigeria, empowering digital success for businesses and individuals through innovative, reliable, and affordable online infrastructure. Founded on June 21, 2024, FeclesHost has rapidly grown to become one of the most trusted names in Africa’s hosting industry. We are committed to delivering excellence through cutting-edge technology, unmatched uptime, and world-class customer support. At FeclesHost, our mission is to make web hosting simple, secure, and scalable — helping entrepreneurs, developers, and enterprises bring their ideas to life on the internet. We are renowned for our responsive customer support, transparent pricing, and customer-first approach, ensuring every client receives real value and confidence in their digital journey.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Back End Developer

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Volunteer

Description


	At FeclesHost, we believe that great companies are built by great people who are passionate, creative, driven, and ready to grow.
	As we continue expanding our digital footprint and pushing new boundaries in hosting, cloud solutions, and user-focused innovation, we are opening our doors to talented individuals who want to be part of something meaningful.


Responsibilities


	Handles server-side logic, database, and integrations. (Ensures everything runs smoothly behind the scenes.)


Requirements


	Candidates should possess relevant qualifications and work experience.


Why You Should Join Us (Even as a Volunteer)


	FeclesHost is still growing, evolving, and building.
	Every step we take opens new opportunities, and every person who joins us becomes part of the foundation of something bigger.
	By joining our team now:
	
		You grow as the company grows every contribution you make becomes part of our long-term story.
		You gain hands-on experience in a high-impact environment where your ideas matter.
		You work closely with a supportive team that believes in collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
		You build a solid portfolio working on real projects that shape real customer experiences.
		You gain visibility and potential transition into paid roles as expansion continues.
	
	


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV or Portfolio to: career@fecleshost.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note


	This Is a voluntary position with opportunities to transition into a paid role.
	For more enquiry contact the recruiter on: +2348138901857 or 

        Click here to Apply

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Summary


	We are on the hunt for a highly analytical and qualified Accounts Officer to join our team. In this pivotal position, your duties will include planning budgets, participating in audits, monitoring financial transactions, posting standard journal entries, managing and reconciling Health Management Organization (HMO) claims and receivables, reconciling payables and bank activities, and serving as the primary liaison between the hospital and HMO partners to ensure prompt and accurate payments.


Requirements


	To succeed in this role, you must demonstrate in-depth knowledge of financial policies, procedures, and systems.
	Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a similar role. &bull; In-depth knowledge of financial regulations and accounting processes.
	In addition to being an excellent communicator, our ideal candidate must be a detailed person with outstanding analytical and time management abilities.
	Candidate must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel and at least one accounting software. Education Requirement: Minimum bachelor&rsquo;s degree or HND in Accounting or Finance. Experience:
	Proven experience in HMO claims management, reconciliation, and liaison within a healthcare setting is essential.


Salary
N300,000 - N350,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;tophireafrica@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accounts Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are on the hunt for a highly analytical and qualified Accounts Officer to join our team. In this pivotal position, your duties will include planning budgets, participating in audits, monitoring financial transactions, posting standard journal entries, managing and reconciling Health Management Organization (HMO) claims and receivables, reconciling payables and bank activities, and serving as the primary liaison between the hospital and HMO partners to ensure prompt and accurate payments.


Requirements


	To succeed in this role, you must demonstrate in-depth knowledge of financial policies, procedures, and systems.
	Minimum 2-3 years of experience in a similar role. • In-depth knowledge of financial regulations and accounting processes.
	In addition to being an excellent communicator, our ideal candidate must be a detailed person with outstanding analytical and time management abilities.
	Candidate must be proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel and at least one accounting software. Education Requirement: Minimum bachelor’s degree or HND in Accounting or Finance. Experience:
	Proven experience in HMO claims management, reconciliation, and liaison within a healthcare setting is essential.
